title: Michael Heseltine
summary: Michael Ray Dibdin Heseltine, Baron Heseltine, CH PC (/ˈhɛzəltaɪn/; born 21 March 1933)[2] is a British politician and businessman. Having begun his career as a property developer, he became one of the founders of the publishing house Haymarket. Heseltine served as a Conservative Member of Parliament from 1966 to 2001, and was a prominent figure in the governments of Margaret Thatcher and John Major, and served as Deputy Prime Minister and First Secretary of State under Major.
